  <div class="pilwrap" id="next.js">
  <h1>
    <a href="#next.js" name="next.js" class="pilcrow"></a>
Next.js
  </h1>
</div>
<p><a href="https://vercel.com"><img alt="Vercel logo" src="https://img.shields.io/badge/MADE%20BY%20Vercel-000000.svg?style=for-the-badge&logo=Vercel&labelColor=000"></a>
<a href="https://www.npmjs.com/package/next"><img alt="NPM version" src="https://img.shields.io/npm/v/next.svg?style=for-the-badge&labelColor=000000"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/vercel/next.js/blob/canary/license.md"><img alt="License" src="https://img.shields.io/npm/l/next.svg?style=for-the-badge&labelColor=000000"></a>
<a href="https://github.com/vercel/next.js/discussions"><img alt="Join the community on GitHub" src="https://img.shields.io/badge/Join%20the%20community-blueviolet.svg?style=for-the-badge&logo=Next.js&labelColor=000000&logoWidth=20"></a></p>
</div>
<div class="pilwrap" id="getting-started">
  <h2>
    <a href="#getting-started" name="getting-started" class="pilcrow"></a>
Getting Started
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Used by some of the world's largest companies, Next.js enables you to create full-stack web applications by extending the latest React features, and integrating powerful Rust-based JavaScript tooling for the fastest builds.</p>
<ul>
<li>Visit our <a href="https://nextjs.org/learn">Learn Next.js</a> course to get started with Next.js.</li>
<li>Visit the <a href="https://nextjs.org/showcase">Next.js Showcase</a> to see more sites built with Next.js.</li>
</ul>
<div class="pilwrap" id="documentation">
  <h2>
    <a href="#documentation" name="documentation" class="pilcrow"></a>
Documentation
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Visit <a href="https://nextjs.org/docs">https://nextjs.org/docs</a> to view the full documentation.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="community">
  <h2>
    <a href="#community" name="community" class="pilcrow"></a>
Community
  </h2>
</div>
<p>The Next.js community can be found on <a href="https://github.com/vercel/next.js/discussions">GitHub Discussions</a> where you can ask questions, voice ideas, and share your projects with other people.</p>
<p>To chat with other community members you can join the Next.js <a href="https://nextjs.org/discord">Discord</a> server.</p>
<p>Do note that our <a href="https://github.com/vercel/next.js/blob/canary/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md">Code of Conduct</a> applies to all Next.js community channels. Users are <strong>highly encouraged</strong> to read and adhere to it to avoid repercussions.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="contributing">
  <h2>
    <a href="#contributing" name="contributing" class="pilcrow"></a>
Contributing
  </h2>
</div>
<p>Contributions to Next.js are welcome and highly appreciated. However, before you jump right into it, we would like you to review our <a href="/contributing.md.html">Contribution Guidelines</a> to make sure you have a smooth experience contributing to Next.js.</p>
<div class="pilwrap" id="good-first-issues">
  <h3>
    <a href="#good-first-issues" name="good-first-issues" class="pilcrow"></a>
Good First Issues:
  </h3>
</div>
<p>We have a list of <strong><a href="https://github.com/vercel/next.js/labels/%22good%20first%20issue%22">good first issues</a></strong> that contain bugs that have a relatively limited scope. This is a great place for newcomers and beginners alike to get started, gain experience, and get familiar with our contribution process.</p>
<hr>
<div class="pilwrap" id="security">
  <h2>
    <a href="#security" name="security" class="pilcrow"></a>
Security
  </h2>
</div>
<p>If you believe you have found a security vulnerability in Next.js, we encourage you to <strong><em>responsibly disclose this and NOT open a public issue</em></strong>.</p>
<p>To participate in our Open Source Software Bug Bounty program, please email <a href="mailto:responsible.disclosure@vercel.com.html">responsible.disclosure@vercel.com</a>. We will add you to the program and provide further instructions for submitting your report.</p>
</div>
  </div>
